videos.title: JavaScript Game Tutorial: The Trolley Problem
videos.metadescription: Join me on another coding adventure as I turn my train simulation into a fun and ethical dilemma game about the trolley problem! 游뚝游냠 In this video, I demonstrate how to create a game where you must divert a train to save a cat, using JavaScript and HTML Canvas. Perfect for beginners and experienced coders alike, this tutorial walks you through:

videos.title: JavaScript Beginner Project Tutorial: The Ebbinghaus Illusion
videos.metadescription: Hey coders! Today, I've got an exciting tutorial for you where we dive into the mesmerizing world of visual illusions. In this video, I'll guide you step by step through coding the Ebbinghaus illusion using JavaScript and HTML Canvas. Plus, we'll take it a step further and add some animation to bring this optical illusion to life!

videos.title: How to Fake data in Apps
videos.metadescription: y, everyone! In this tutorial, I'll show you a simple trick using browser developer tools to generate fake data in Gmail. It's a handy technique to capture screenshots without exposing any personal information. Whether you want to share your screen for tutorials, presentations, or just to keep your sensitive details private, this method works like a charm!

videos.title: Aprende React en 45 Minutos
videos.metadescription: Convertite en React developer en 45 minutos.

videos.title: CLASES VS F츼BRICAS EN JAVASCRIPT

videos.title: 18 JavaScript Projects for Students
videos.metadescription: In this video I present 18 JavaScript projects suitable for Students. These projects were implemented by my students during the Visual Web Development course of 2021. They are all JavaScript projects, predominantly vanilla JavaScript and HTML Canvas. Some libraries are used in some cases like ThreeJS and Handtrack JS.

videos.title: 76 JavaScript projects in 24 hours: Coding Ultramarathon (Part 1)
videos.metadescription: First 10 hours and 11 minutes of the 24 h coding ultramarathon challenge where I built 76 HTML canvas projects using vanilla JavaScript and no external libraries

videos.title: Learn Trigonometry with JavaScript
videos.metadescription: We study trigonometry by implementing an interactive tool in JavaScript. We learn several trigonometrical functions like the sine, cosine and tangent (sin, cos, tan) and their inverse functions: the arcsine, arccosine and arctangent (asin, acos, atan). We define these functions using a right angle triangle at first and then extend the definitions using the unit circle.

videos.title: Learn 2D Vectors with JavaScript
videos.metadescription: We study 2D vectors by implementing an interactive tool in JavaScript. We learn about the cartesian representation and the polar representation. And vector operations like addition, subtraction, scaling, normalization and how to calculate the dot product. We use what we learn about vectors to draw vectors (an arrow) and visualize the different operations in an interactive way.

videos.title: Pythagorean Theorem: Proof, Applications and JavaScript Code
videos.metadescription: The Pythagorean theorem is one of the most useful things in the world! It helps me to make Games, Location-based Systems, Augmented reality Apps, Machine learning projects  but also to build things in the real world like this swing!
